thread.title: Nationwide child exploitation sting puts 8 behind bars from Eugene to Vancouver
thread.title_full: Nationwide child exploitation sting puts 8 behind bars from Eugene to Vancouver | OregonLive.com

author: Bryan Denson | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Nationwide child exploitation sting puts 8 behind bars from Eugene to Vancouver
text:
Child exploitation teams swept through cities from Eugene to Vancouver last week, pulling three sex-trafficking victims away from their pimps, putting a toddler in safe hands and arresting eight adults for promoting prostitution from Salem to Vancouver, the FBI reported Tuesday.
The ninth iteration of Operation Cross Country , a nationwide sting orchestrated by the FBI and the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children, sent 73 state and local task forces into 135 cities. They targeted criminal enterprises behind commercial sex trafficking of children , according to an FBI news release.
Authorities announced these arrests in local cities: Christine M. Goldlen, 32, and John Follstad-Martin, 31, in Portland; James E. Donaldson, 42, Jerome D. Akles, 48, and Veronica A. Britt, 25, in Vancouver; Marlon Slaffey, 37, and Mazio Lincoln Frasier, 45, in Beaverton; and David W. Fair Jr., 39, in Salem.
The National Center for Missing & Exploited Children reported that 149 children were recovered in the coast-to-coast stings.
"Human trafficking is a monstrous and devastating crime that steals lives and degrades our nation," Attorney General Loretta Lynch said in a news release. "As a result of the FBI's outstanding coordination and exemplary efforts alongside state and local partners during Operation Cross Country, more children will sleep safely tonight, and more wrongdoers will face the judgment of our criminal justice system."
-- Bryan Denson
bdenson@oregonian.com
503-294-7614; @Bryan_Denson
